Wassaic Branch Substitute Busing, select trains Thurs. & Fri. 7/20 & 7/21, and all Sat. & Sun., 7/22-7/23

Substitute bus service will be provided between Southeast and Wassaic on Thursday July 20, for select AM and PM trains starting with the 7:53 AM train (from Grand Central Terminal). On Friday, July 21, substitute bus service will be provided for select PM trains starting with the 8:52 PM train (from Grand Central Terminal). For full schedule, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_7_20_21.pdf On Saturday and Sunday, substitute bus service will be provided for all trains starting with the 5:52 AM (bus time) from Wassaic. For full schedule see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_7_22_23.pdf Please note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we complete this important track work.

Danbury Branch Weekend Busing Fri. Evening July 7, All Day Sat. & Sun July 8 & 9

Substitute busing will be in effect on the Danbury Branch beginning with select trains after 9 PM on Friday, July 7, and all day Saturday and Sunday, July 8 - 9, until the last train leaving Grand Central Terminal for Danbury at 11:26 PM. See bus schedule at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Danbury_Busing_7_3_rev.pdf Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we conduct track work on the Danbury Branch.

Z Line - Weekday Planned Service Changes

All times until Summer 2017 Manhattan-bound Z trains skip 121 St and 104 St, due to station rehabilitation. To these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Manhattan-bound J to 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd and transfer to a Jamaica Center-bound J. From these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Q56 bus and transfer to/from J service at nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd. Note: Jamaica Center-bound J trains skip 104 St and 121 St from 5:30 PM to 6:30 PM, weekdays; take a Q56 bus or the Z instead. All times until April 30, 2018 Z trains run local in both directions between Broadway Junction and Marcy Av, due to viaduct reconstruction.
W Line - Weekday Planned Service Changes

10 AM to 3 PM, Tue to Fri, Jul 11 - 14 No W trains between 57 St-7 Av and Ditmars Blvd; W trains run every 20 minutes, due to track maintenance. Take the N instead. W service operates between Whitehall St and 57 St-7 Av, and via the Q to/from 96 St. Transfer between N and W trains at Times Sq-42 St. Note: Coney Island-bound N trains skip 30 Av, Broadway, 36 Av, and 39 Av during this time.
S Line - Weekday and Weeknight Planned Service Changes

See bus schedule at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Danbury_Busing_7_3_rev.pdf Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Metro-North's West of Hudson July 4th Holiday Service

Take Metro-North's West of Hudson July 4th Holiday service and declare your independence from traffic and tolls. On Monday, July 3, a regular weekday schedule will be operated. On Tuesday, July 4, we will operate a weekend schedule with an extra inbound train from Port Jervis. See full details at http://ow.ly/TlMf30cVGQd Have a happy and safe July 4th Holiday!

Metro-North's West of Hudson July 4th Holiday Service

Take Metro-North's West of Hudson July 4th Holiday service and declare your independence from traffic and tolls. On Friday, June 30, for your getaway, Port Jervis and Pascack Valley trains will have some extended service. On Monday, July 3, a regular weekday schedule will be operated. On Tuesday, July 4, we will operate a weekend schedule with an extra inbound train from Port Jervis. See full details at http://ow.ly/TlMf30cVGQd Have a happy and safe July 4th Holiday!

Declare your independence from traffic and tolls this July 4th holiday by taking Metro-North to celebrate our nation's birthday. There are plenty of early getaway trains on Friday, June 30. On Monday, July 3, Metro-North will operate a regular weekday schedule. On Tuesday, July 4, we will operate a Sunday schedule (with one additional outbound New Haven Line train) to get you to and from the annual Macy's Fireworks. See full details at http://ow.ly/LP9D30cVH6c Have a happy and safe July 4th Holiday!
